conclusion: Understand the behavior of the electric field inside the capacitor before and after the metal plate is removed.
The capacitor has two plates separated by a distance d, and a metal plate of thickness l is inserted into the gap.
The metal plate effectively reduces the effective gap between the capacitor plates to d - l.
The electric field E_0 in the region above the metal plate is given by E_0 = V / (d - l).
The force due to the electric field balances the gravitational force, qE_0 = mg.
Derive qV = mg(d - l) from q(V / (d - l)) = mg.
When the metal plate is removed, the effective gap returns to d, and the new electric field E is V / d.
The force due to the new electric field on the particle is F_electric = q(V / d).
Substitute qV = mg(d - l) into the expression for electric force, F_electric = mg(d-l)/d.
Calculate net force: F_net = F_electric - mg = mg((d-l)/d - 1) = -mgl/d.
The acceleration a of the particle is given by a = F_net/m = -gl/d.
The magnitude of the acceleration is gl/d.
